Detailed Description

The reply that is send from the MapModule with the names of the items.

Create a new Item names request packet from the corresponding request packet.

p The question that was send to the MapModule.

Member Function Documentation

bool ItemNamesReplyPacket::addName (  uint32  itemID,
const char *  name
) 
 

Add one name to this packet.

Parameters:
itemID The ID of the item who have the name.
name The name of the item with ID = itemID.
Returns:
True if the item is added, false otherwise (probably the packet is full).

int ItemNamesReplyPacket::getFirstNamePosition (   )  const
 

Get the position of the fist name.

This should be used in the getNextName-method. E.g. {verbatim} int pos = p->getFirstNamePosition(); for (int j=0; j<p->getNbrNames(); j++) { uint32 i; const char* n = p->getNextName(pos, i); ... } {verbatim}

Returns:
The position of the first name in this packet.

uint32 ItemNamesReplyPacket::getMapID (   )  const
 

Get the ID of the map where the items in this reply are located.

Returns:
The ID of the map where the items are located.

uint32 ItemNamesReplyPacket::getNbrNames (   )  const
 

Get the number of names in this packet.

Returns:
The numberof names in this packet.

const char* ItemNamesReplyPacket::getNextName (  int &  pos,
uint32 &  itemID
)  const
 

Get the next name in this packet.

Parameters:
pos In/out-parameter that is used to keep track of the position inside the packet. Updated to the next string before returning.
itemID Outparameter that is set to the ID of the item that have the name that is returned.
Returns:
A pointer to the name of item with ID = itemID. { { NB!} This must no be deleted and must not be used when this packetis deleted}.
